Bears were large and ferocious animals
column2: notorious for their love of honey.

column1: ==History==
Bears lived in the Misty Mountains for some time
column2: though by the late Third Age
column3: their number had diminished. Gandalf told Bilbo Baggins that giants had taken up their homes in that mountain range. One of the alleged origins of Beorn
column5: was that he had descended from them.

column1: ==Etymology==
Early Noldorin had two words for bear: brôg
column3: entry MOROK and megli (with the variation meglivorn "Black bear")
column6: only the word graw is attested
column8: p. 12 (note 3) though Didier Willis also suggested the "updated" word Medli.Didier Willis
column10: http://groups.yahoo.com/group/elfling/message/4007 message 4007 A Quenya word for "bear" is given as morco
column11: sharing a Sundocarmë with brôg. A variant Quenya name for "bear" is given as morokō (and mor(o)kē

column1: ==Other versions of the legendarium==
In the earliest outlines of The Fall of Gondolin (chapter)
column2: Tuor was clad in the skins of bears. The sinews of bears were also used to make bowstring
column3: "The Lay of the Children of Húrin"

column1: ==Other fiction==
Bears play a significantly bigger role in other stories
column2: most notably Mr. Bliss and The Father Christmas Letters.

column1: * The former included three mischievous bears Archie
column3: who more resemble teddybears in Tolkiens drawings.J.R.R. Tolkien

column1: * The North Polar Bear helped Father Christmas writing his letters by making side comments. Other polar bears were Paksu and Valkotukka.J.R.R. Tolkien
==Portrayal in adaptations==
2003: The Hobbit (2003 video game):
:Beorn appears only in the shape of a black bear.The Hobbit (2003 video game)
2006: The Lord of the Rings: The Battle for Middle-earth:
:Bears appear as wildlife in the map "Mirkwood".The Lord of the Rings: The Battle for Middle-earth
2007: The Lord of the Rings Online:
:Bears are found in many places of Middle-earth and range in size of large dog to the size of a small elephant. They are typically not aggressive
column2: but will fight if the player threatens them. Players that are lore-masters are able to use a bear as a combat pet.

column1: 2012-14: The Hobbit (film series):
:Beorn appears in the form of brown bear
column2: both in the The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug and the The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies film.
